metadata.Title: CVE-2022-43995 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description: Sudo 1.8.0 through 1.9.12, with the crypt() password backend, contains a plugins/sudoers/auth/passwd.c array-out-of-bounds error that can result in a heap-based buffer over-read. This can be triggered by arbitrary local users with access to Sudo by entering a password of seven characters or fewer. The impact could vary depending on the system libraries, compiler, and processor architecture.

notes.Note: mdeslaur> sudo packages in Ubuntu are compiled with PAM support, so the vulnerable code isn't part of the binaries.

criterions.comment: sudo: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
